decks.notes: This deck revolves around assembling a powerful combo involving Mystic Forge, Basalt Monolith, and Voltaic Key to generate a lot of mana and play multiple spells in a single turn. The deck uses various artifacts like Mox Opal and Urza's lands to accelerate its game plan, while also utilizing Karn, the Great Creator to lock down opponent's resources. The end goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful artifacts and spells, ultimately leading to victory through overwhelming board presence and resource advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping mana to cheat powerful creatures into play using cards like Sneak Attack and Yggdrasil, Rebirth Engine. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Koma, World-Eater. Chalice of the Void and Sundering Eruption help control the board while Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal provide additional acceleration. The inclusion of Djeru and Hazoret, as well as Atraxa, Grand Unifier, offer support and protection for the combo pieces. The deck aims to win fast and decisively through explosive plays.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board with efficient removal spells and disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Daze, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and tempo by countering key spells with Force of Will and utilizing card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. With a mix of disruption, aggression, and card advantage, this Dimir Tempo deck aims to outmaneuver and outpace the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, and then bring them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes countermagic like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces, while also having disruptive cards like Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has some versatile creatures like Brazen Borrower and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to provide additional threats and value. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through powerful combos and reanimation strategies.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Nomads en-Kor, Cephalid Illusionist, and Shuko to mill the entire library, triggering Narcomoeba and Thassa's Oracle for the win. The deck includes protection with Force of Will and counterspells, as well as card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. The inclusion of cards like Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Urza's Saga provide additional value and consistency to the combo. The deck also utilizes lands like Flooded Strand and Misty Rainforest to fix mana and access necessary colors.

The main concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by efficiently disrupting their strategy with counter spells, removal spells, and hand disruption. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Thoughtseize, and Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the game tempo and maintain board presence while deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf to close out the game quickly. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent access to both colors while also disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland. The deck's strategy revolves around aggression and disruption to secure victory.

The deck revolves around quickly assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game. It utilizes various forms of card draw and acceleration to find and cast Doomsday, followed by using key cards like Thassa's Oracle and Lion's Eye Diamond to secure victory. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. The deck is focused on efficiently and effectively executing the combo as quickly as possible while also being able to interact with the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back to the battlefield through reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also utilizes counterspells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its game plan and disruption spells like Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brainstorm provide card selection and advantage, while creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty offer powerful threats to close out the game. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands for consistency and access to all necessary colors.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with artifact creatures and utilize various artifacts to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Through the use of cards like Mox Opal, Lotus Petal, and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to generate mana quickly to play powerful artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will to protect its board state. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thought Monitor provide card advantage and recursion, while cards like Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on assembling the Cephalid combo using cards like Nomads en-Kor and Cephalid Illusionist to mill cards and trigger abilities that allow the player to quickly draw through their deck and win the game with cards like Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Stifle to protect the combo and interact with the opponent's game plan. With a mix of card draw, protection, and combo pieces, the deck aims to swiftly execute its game plan and win before the opponent can respond effectively.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategy while also generating card advantage through flicker effects and tutoring. The deck aims to pressure the opponent's life total while also disrupting their game plan, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of efficient creatures, removal spells, and disruption. Additionally, the deck utilizes a strong mana base to ensure consistency and the ability to cast spells in a timely manner.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful, fast creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Magus of the Moon and Fury, while also dealing direct damage with spells like Sundering Eruption and Shatterskull Smashing. The goal is to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and close out the game before the opponent can react effectively.

The deck focuses on cheating powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Archon of Cruelty onto the battlefield with Show and Tell and Omniscience. By using Thassa's Oracle and Thought Lash in combination with Stock Up to filter the deck, players can win the game quickly by either emptying the library or through combat damage. The goal is to set up a fast and explosive win condition through powerful combo plays. The deck relies heavily on card draw and protection spells like Force of Will to ensure a smooth setup.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Griselbrand or Emrakul, then using various spells like Reanimate and Shallow Grave to bring them back onto the battlefield. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Daze to control the opponent's resources. Its goal is to execute a powerful combo by cheating out massive creatures ahead of schedule, overwhelming the opponent with a quick and lethal assault. By utilizing a proactive strategy and combining graveyard manipulation with reanimation spells, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can react effectively.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy threats and disrupt opponent's game plan through powerful tempo plays. Utilizing efficient counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, alongside powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Dragon's Rage Channeler, the deck aims to pressure opponents while disrupting their strategies. The deck also relies on card selection and card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Mishra's Bauble to maintain consistency and outmaneuver opponents. Wasteland and other land disruption cards further help in slowing down opponents while the deck aims to close out the game in a swift manner.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic and removal spells. It aims to control the board while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent. Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm provide card selection and help set up favorable draws. The deck also utilizes disruptive lands like Wasteland to slow down the opponent. Overall, the strategy of this UR Aggro deck is to maintain tempo and apply pressure to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.
